Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Small scarab with the head and clypeus depicted, but not the prothorax or the elytra. The legs are indicated by diagonal incisions. The reverse bears spirals and flowers, a motif much appreciated at the end of the Middle Kingdom.
